abstract: The New Museum abandoned plans for group use of the large sensory deprivation tank in its new show of the work of Belgium-born artist Carsten Höller, after officials from the city's Department of Health told the museum that it needed city approval and a permit for such collective activities.

lead_paragraph: "Everybody into the pool!" will no longer work so well as a catchphrase for the New Museum's career survey of the adventurous work of the Belgium-born artist Carsten Höller, which opened last week. As one of its showstoppers, the exhibition includes a giant sensory deprivation tank created by Mr. Höller, in which museumgoers are invited to disrobe and lie in heavily salted water with a few friends or strangers to achieve a kind of out-of-body experience.

headline.main: City Nixes New Museum's Group Soaking Sessions
